page.title: 01Great Langdale, Cumbria
page.content: The valley and the surrounding foothills are among the most popular tourist places in the Lake District, as well as supporting sheep and dairy farming. The valley affords access to the surounding Langdale fells which provide more adventurous country for the fell walker, whilst the steep cliffs and crags at the head of the valley, behind the Old Dungeon Ghyll Hotel, are popular rock climbing locations. Perhaps the most visual spot in the fells is Stickle Ghyll, and on the footpath much valuable restoration work has been done during the 1980's by the National Trust and the Manpower Services Commission to combat the erosion caused by several hundred visitors daily during the summer season. A new bridge below the falls concentrates walkers onto the eastern bank. Similar schemes
